question: Which country is set to start ‘Human challenge’ trials to fast-track COVID-19 vaccine search?
explanation:
The United Kingdom government recently announced that around 90 volunteers will be recruited to be exposed to small amounts of the novel coronavirus in a controlled setting.
This process is carried under the first stage of “Human challenge” trials to speed up the search for a viable COVID-19 vaccine. It also involves a 33.6-million-pound investment. The studies would start in January next year.
